genetics.definition: a characteristic (like eye tongue rolling) that is controlled by genes
product of reproduction (in humans, offspring are children of parents)
the appearance and observed traits of an organism
diagram used to predict the genes that offspring could get from two parents
the allele that is visible in an organism
the allele that is invisible in an organism when a dominant allele is present
has two of the same alleles
a molecule that holds the instructions for building an organism
a piece of DNA that has the instructions for making a protein
traits are passed from parents to offspring through reproduction
pairs of chromosomes arranged from biggest to smallest
